intro: Corispermum erosum, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae, which includes many salt-tolerant species. The plant has small, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, helping to reduce water loss in dry environments. Its flowers are unisexual, with both male and female flowers occurring on the same plant, and it produces small, dry fruits known as utricles. Corispermum erosum is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
